intro: Mesembryanthemum fraternum, commonly known as the common ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Mesembryanthemum fraternum is often used in rock gardens and as a ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal.
